author: 1neta I
text: 'I‚Äôm in love with this restaurant and most importantly the staff. The food is always delicious and comforting. The host and cooks are extremely friendly and caring. Id make it a point to try their stew‚Äôs for this chilly weather. The lamb shank does not disappoint at all. Stop by it‚Äôs worth it!'

author: Kathleen Heaney
text: 'One of the best restaurants in Hoboken. The food is superb. I wish I could eat the chicken kebab every day!'

author: Family Fan
text: 'Really wanted to like this place. I love Persian food and eat it pretty often. The food was ok. Kebabs were decent but portions a bit small and seasoning alright. But the rice was undercooked so it made the meal a bit underwhelming. I would‚Äôve still given it 4 stars but the service was pretty mediocre - wait staff was surprisingly not friendly or engaging in any way. I may come back to try the tadig and gormeh shabzi but was disappointed overall.'

author: Kate Tell
text: 'Great brunch! Breakfast potatoes and hummus were the highlights. Get the tea too.'

author: Gerson Gomez
text: "Food was delicious
column5: parking is a very hectic as you can't find anything close by

author: David Torres
text: 'Best Mediterranean rice in town!! Highly recommended.'

author: jon
text: 'Incredible!!!! Ordered 2 days in a row food is so good fresh and you can tell good quality meat. Really happy this place opened and its nearby in hoboken. An absolute gem if you are looking for middle eastern food. I get the chicken soltani! Its so addicting. Thank you!!!! We needed this in hoboken.'

author: Mitra Dowlatshahi
text: 'Lots of very nice outdoor seating. Service is lovely. The chicken breast kabob is seriously the best I have ever had.'

author: Milad Mahdian
text: 'This is by far the worst persian food we ever had
column5: ever. The meat in kebab (we got the filet minion) smelled pretty bad. The chicken kebab was ok. The worst of the worst award goes to the gheymeh Bademjoon. It was smelly stale and ‚Äúmaside‚Äù. Finally ghorme sabzi was bland
column6: or as we Persians say ‚Äúja nayoftade bood‚Äù'

author: Matthew Boyer
text: 'Seven Valleys is great. They have the best chicken kabob in town. Their flavored rices are also excellent. If I had to offer one area of criticism it is their bread. It‚Äôs almost always pretty dry and tastes stale. If they revamped that they‚Äôd really have the full package.'

author: Torey Lehman
text: 'First time trying tonight and it‚Äôs excellent!'

author: Alexia Edwards
text: 'Absolutely amazing food! The service was great and the waiter was especially helpful in making suggestions and explaining the flavour profile of each dish. Such flavourful and aromatic option; highly recommend the Persian lemonade & the Persian ice cream. Definitely suggest dining here!'

author: Andreas Hadjiapostoli
text: 'Food quality was poor
column5: cold
column6: and extremely small portion for delivery. Ex. Shirazi salad was all cucumbers that were old and in a small plastic container (the same of which you would get at a cheap Chinese restaurant).'

author: Maddie Jewell
text: 'Truly my favorite place to dine in Hoboken. The chicken is always juicy and delicious and the cherry rice keeps me coming back! I‚Äôve tried many of the appetizers as well
column5: and I truly have never had anything disappointing. Highly recommend for anyone wanting a delicious meal!'

author: Amy
text: "Disappointed with the quantity of food we received through Ubereats. Though the food was good
column5: paying 19$ for koubideh that was very thin and takeout box not filled all the way felt like a rip off - they could have at least given more rice to fill us up more. The quantity of the takeout didn't look comparable to the pictures I saw posted by others that dined in"

author: Ilayda Karabayir
text: 'We always here for our Persian food cravings. The food portions are small but the food is very delicious. The service is very much on point.'

author: Sundeep Rangan
text: 'Ghormeh sabzi was excellent'

author: Amed Logrono
text: 'Amazing food
column5: everything fresh

author: Negin Moh
text: 'Happy to have a Persian restaurant in the neighborhood! The food tastes quite good and original
column5: but portions are really small compared to standard expectation from Persian foods and the prices don‚Äôt reflect that.'

author: willzy34
text: 'Trust the 5 star reviews.  Really good food here.  The medley for two was more than enough.'

author: Shamsher Sachdeva
text: 'But far the best kaboodeh kabab I have ever eaten!! This place is my favorite.'

author: Ross Marullo
text: "I've really enjoyed every meal I've had at Seven Valleys. The food is amazing
column5: the staff are very friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. If your stopping by during lunch they have a great special that comes with desert. I absolutely recommend this place."

author: Stephen Bellamy
text: 'Koobideh
column5: saffron rice and heaps of sumac... makes me very happy. Love this place!'

author: Seraphim
text: 'The vegan cake is absolutely delicious and definitely the reason for me to come back!!! All the stews are awesome too.'

author: jamson0
text: 'I went to this restaurant last night and my experience was less than subpar.   They had one person taking orders and serving tables.  The guy must apologize to table and take out orders at least 20 times in an hour sitting which speaks\n\nFood was good though
column5: however I don‚Äôt like to be charged for things I am not aware of.  The same guy mentioned above asked us if we wanted the filet or hanger steak w the Medley
column6:
obviously filet would always be our choice.  Where he failed was he didn‚Äôt tell me it was an extra charge for the filet.  The menu didn‚Äôt even say it which is big miss on the restaurant‚Äôs part.  No one wants to be surprised about an up-charge.

They also ran out of the eggplant at 7pm on a Saturday which didn‚Äôt really make sense with the Persian new year close ( I think).  Small menu. Should never run out of food

I won‚Äôt go back'

author: Darek Michael
text: 'The chicken soltani.... WOWüòç I‚Äôve been going through the menu and ordering something new everything but this chicken prepared in their special yogurt sauce hits the spot great place to eat at or order on ChowNow!'

author: joanne Hazel Matthew
text: 'Ordered the Masto Khair and I must say it was the worst representation of of Persian food culture.  Ok
column5: the yogurt sauce was doable but the bread was dry and stale.   I am having a really difficult time understanding how they can possibly sell stale bread and charge Money for the exchange.  The lamb kabob was a meager portion and the rice and stew was a child‚Äôs serving. The place is overpriced and the food is absolutely not good.'

author: Cayce Connolly
text: 'Unique and necessary place for Hoboken. The food is incredible
column5: especially the desserts. I also recommend their lunch special if you can‚Äôt make it in for dinner. Certainly a treat and I will be coming back frequently!'

author: Melinda Huang
text: 'Persian food... super yummy. Two thumbs up for this place. This place has an awesome atmosphere.'

author: Lily Mcmahon
text: 'Excellent spot for tasty Persian food. Visited on a Thursday. The staff was very kind and attentive. It has an awesome atmosphere.'

author: Zoya Samadi
text: 'There was the worst persian restaurant I have ever been in New Jersey. Its quality is very low and the prices are too high.'

author: Erica R
text: 'Ordered take out from their website and have only great things to say. The baklava is wonderful and you can really tell that they pay attention to every detail. The chicken kebabs were wonderful too. Highly reccomend both!\n\n(The picture is missing a piece of baklava... Delicious!)'

author: Sahand Seif
text: "Good quality persian food! But the portions were relatively small for a persian meal
column5: and that's why I'm giving 4 star instead of 5."

author: Marcelo Hernandez
text: "Small family place taste middle eastern type food... friendly... parking in Hoboken. Is a little headache....but it's worth it...BYO  call them for the menu..."

author: Conner R
text: "Good location for quality persian food. Got there near five
column5: it wasn't very busy. The service was very sociable and kind. Bring your hunger - portions are large. Makes me feel like I am back in Tucson."

author: shane kovacs
text: 'Delivery took forever....'

author: Kaitlin Walsh
text: 'Nice site for tasty persian food. the staff was very friendly and attentive. this place has a cool atmosphere.'

author: Mila Petrova
text: 'Amazing !!!! Everything about this meal was amazing. They have to make the best baklava ever. It‚Äôs just perfect. This place will become a staple in our take out food orders.'

author: Ani Blinova
text: "So flavorful! The best food we've had in Hoboken so far."

author: ally Ramadan
text: 'It was okay.'

author: Kelly O'Mara
text: 'Delicious
column5: great portion sizes. Definitely a new go-to. Worth paying extra for the special rices and of course dessert.'

author: Shaheen Ali
text: 'Excellent food. I got the chicken kabob platter. The chicken was flavorful and juicy
column5: and the rice was fluffy and very buttery.'

author: Anna Lukovskiy
text: 'Absolutely excellent!'

author: Andrew ‚ÄúWoodyWilson‚Äù Hughes
text: 'Not what i expected. Food was very expensive and only for those trying to keep vampires away. Sooo much garlic =(. Really disappointing because I have been meaning to try here for a while.'

author: Kristina Bodnya
text: 'Everything is great but the food is exceptionally delicious!'

author: Myles Helfand
text: "Tiny
column5: gloriously unique Persian place in the heart of a town with two Italian restaurants on every block. Comfy chairs and a light indoor-veranda feel. Just enough of y'all need to go here that the place is busy and successful without making me wait 30 mins to get in for dinner."

author: Aviva Morgenstern
text: "Fantastic
column5: fresh and authentic food. I've eaten both I'm restaurant and takeout and both have been great experiences. I highly recommend this restaurant!"

author: Alvin ALUNAN
text: "I've never eaten anything but a good dinner at Seven Valleys."

author: Pri Robin
text: "Very tasty food... Love their baklava
column5: the best I've every had in NYC area."

author: Bruce Mn
text: 'Had a great experience at this place. Food was great and felt like home.'

author: Parth Soni
text: 'This is a hidden gem in Hoboken! The best thing is their deserts
column5: they are so yummm!!'

author: Andrea Sartori-Coyle
text: 'Cozy
column5: warm and inviting space with delicious food and lovely staff. BYOB.'

author: Rouzbeh D.
text: 'Microwaved food'

author: Ludovic MASSON
text: "Delicious !!! Well cooked
column5: lot of perfumes and really tasty !! I definitely recommend this place.\nOne little
column6: we waited a little to be served
column8: really !!\nAnd the decoration of the restaurant is nice and 'quiet'.\nWell welcomed too !!"

author: Michael Ts
text: "If you like unique stews and great quality kabobs
column5: definitely do not miss out on this place. A compact but varied menu
column7: and super wait staff made for a lovely experience. Each bite of the lentil and tomato beef was heavenly
column8: highly recommend. A bit removed from the hectic bar scene of Hoboken
column9: so the meal was peaceful. Definitely check it out
column10: it's well worth any drive over or wait to sit"

author: Jonathan Greenstein
text: 'Lamb and fill rice were amazing.  Compliment yogurt and bread also delish.'

author: Jo Hayes
text: 'Great kabobs!! Everything else is good but the mains are the best.'

author: S. H.
text: 'I have a lot of experience w Iranian food. This is some of the best in NYNJ area. My woman likes it too. Skrt skrt'

author: Virginia Patrone
text: "Absolutely delicious food and a very welcome additional option in the unending sea of Italian and sushi joints in Hoboken. Vibe inside is relaxed with a modern aesthetic
column5: and service is super friendly. The cherry rice is drool-worthy - honestly would be worth going back just for that. But
column6: I'll be back anyway for all of the yummy starters and entrees."

author: Brady Montoya
text: "Ok location for tasty Persian food. got there about one
column5: it wasn't busy. the service was friendly and observant. this place has a great design. food is similar to a place in san francisco i liked."

author: Kim Mattappallil
text: "The food was out of this world and the recommendations the waitress made were spot on. Had the chicken and ground beef kebabs
column5: which were hands down the best I've ever tasted. We tried both beef stews as well (one with tahdig and one as an entree) and
column6: while we preferred the one that had been suggested by the waitress
column7: both were fantastic. It's hard to say whether we were more in love with the food or with the atmosphere/people."

author: L Z
text: 'Food is excellent.'

author: Peace Fla
text: 'While staying in Hoboken NJ I have eaten at Seven Valleys several times. Their chicken kabob is so moist and tender!  The atmosphere is very charming. The service has been nothing but friendly.  I‚Äôm looking forward to visiting Hoboken again just so I can eat here!  I‚Äôm now hooked on Persian food!'

author: Ammar Albayati
text: 'Good'

author: Sana Zareey
text: 'Delicious food
column5: wonderful staff

author: amruta shinde
text: 'Good food. The saffron icecream is very tasty.'

author: Renato Fava
text: 'Authentic Persian food!'

author: Dillon Wu
text: "Cozy modern restaurant with Incredible food and great service!  Try the cherried rice
column5: it's unbelievable!"

author: Nadja K√∂rner
text: 'Very good authentic Persian food. The thadig & rice tasted like in Iran!'

author: doina elezi
text: 'Pretty impressed! Ordered delivery last night via Chownow. The food was amazing and came on time. Looking forward to try the place inside. I have been told it‚Äôs gorgeous.'

author: Bonnie White
text: 'persian food
column5: mmm
column6: very tasty. I really loved this place. Service treated us so kindly. Makes me feel like I am back in Sacramento.'

author: Christina Rivero
text: 'Bread was not great. Stale and not soft. Served at room temperature. Portions are tiny. Tahdig very tiny portion. Kabobs are not grilled they are baked. Overall ok but not great for location and pricing.'

author: Douglas Lindstedt
text: 'Exceptional is the only the beginning when describing the food here. This is some of the best tasting
column5: flavorful and delicious food that I have ever had. It was such a pleasure to eat food that you can tell was crafted from an experienced chef that poured their heart into it.  The quaint ambiance only added to the phenomenal food. I left feeling satiated
column7: but perfectly satisfied even waiving off dessert because I did not want chance ruining the "good mouth feels" that dinner left me. If I could give Seven Valleys my own rating
column8: it would be 12 stars out of 5. A true pleasurable memorable evening that will be repeated over and over again!'

author: Hen Pastry Chef
text: "I think it's the best persian restaurant I have been. And I have been in a lot ! The food is delicious. It doesn't seem like a typical persian restaurant it's quite modern.  small but warm and unic we really loved everything we tried and it was a lot. The plates are big so you can definitely order some and share.\nDist miss the cherries rice. For me it was the best!"

author: KM G
text: 'Absolute sham! Dont bother ordering from this place. Ordered a eggplant kabob and it didnt have a single piece of eggplant. The delivery guy was so late and lied to us that "he called like 20 times". We then waited outside for 20 mins before the food was delivered to us.'

author: William L
text: 'Nice intimate space with very flavourful food.'

author: Rich Slaby
text: "We've had great and OK experiences here. Giving them the benefit of the doubt on an overpriced not great chicken special recently. The char special was great as were the previous visits."

author: Sanam Hashimi
text: 'The food is not good. The Shirazi salad was old. The cucumbers were setting in lemon juice for so long that became mushy. We asked for salad instead rice. Half a cup of mix spring and one olive and two cherry tomatoes. The portion was so small that we had to grab take out for dinner. Not recommending it.'

author: Kyle Reinfried
text: "Tried to go to seven valleys when it first opened
column5: it was packed (it's a small space
column6: but good for them) and they werent (still don't ?) take reservations.\n\nSo I returned a couple months later and very much enjoyed my meal. It was very good
column7: pretty traditional Persian food. Persian food is very under represented in North Jersey
column8: specifically Hoboken and Jersey City. I feel comfortable saying that having lived in both.\n\nIt was a little pricey for the size of the portions
column9: at least compared to other Persian restaurants I've been to
column10: like Ravagh in nyc. I can't say anything else negative about it. Every dish was delicious
column11: in particular the lamb shank. The meat so easily pulling off the bone and the broth was delicious and great to poor over the rice."

author: Faranak Walipour
text: 'My husband & I have been here 3x already & each time the food tastes better! The ghormeh Sabzi was delightful - just the way my mother in law makes it! This is one of the best Persian restaurants we‚Äôve been to. The restaurant is gorgeous & the food is delicious! Definitely recommend this place!'

author: Iran Walipour
text: 'Delicious Persian food! Gorgeous ambiance & wonderful staff! Definitely recommend!!'

author: Ash Sinai
text: 'Best Persian resturant in New Jersey! loved the decor and the kebab is on point! my Persian friends agreed
column5: we all loved this place.'

author: Javier Suarez
text: 'Beautiful'

author: Niki Poveromo
text: 'Loved everything about our meal here.  The ambiance is cozy and warm
column5: the food was perfectly seasoned and flavorful
column6: with great portion sizes.  Cannot wait to go back
column7: and looking forward to brunch being offered!'

author: Mehrdad Nosrati
text: 'Small but Cozy with delicious foods.\n\nThe restaurant is clean and neat with a very nice decoration. Their foods are really tasty. I have tried their Koobideh
column5: Beef
column6:
and Chicken dishes. The chicken kabob portion was a little bit small though. The owner was very friendly and nice.

I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a new and different food in Hoboken.

The only drawback is the wait line. They do not accept reservation in advance and because of the limited space
column7: you should expect to wait for a while to be seated.'

author: Mona Rosenthal
text: 'Food was perfect
column5: I really enjoyed of ghormesabzi

author: Silvia Chapman
text:
'Good home made Persian food. The eggplant appetiser was really tasty. The Decor is super cute and well done.

Downside is that they need to get proper ventilation as all the smells from the kitchen leave with you and your clothes.

I am definitely going to eat there again just probably pick up and eat at home until they fix the vent situation.'

author: Saam Hooshmand
text: "Charming place with great food that reminds me of mom's cooking.  Excited to sample the rest of the menu."

author: Christian martinez
text: 'Overall - Okay but over priced Persian food (other restaurants give more)\n\nI believe since it was the second day opening
column5: and they didn‚Äôt expect their Tuesday to be overwhelmed with curious foodies.\n\nFirst
column6: dinning area is very tiny the total square footage is about 180 sqft
column7:
fits about 7 tiny tables at most. I believe the back area is 4 times bigger than the dinning area.

Their decor is pretty nice

Now
column8: let‚Äôs talk about service and food.\n\nLike I mentioned before
column9: I believe it‚Äôs due to them not expecting the crowd; these people had no idea how to control 3 couples that were waiting or where to seat them (due to the lack of space).\n\nThey have 1 waiter and possibly 1 cook
column10: I had to get the manager to get us our food and drinks because there were too many people.\n\nOrdered the food
column11: they forgot the appetizer.\n\nBrought the Kebobs
column12: and the beef kebobs were not well cooked; they were partially turned into charcoal and then some parts were medium then the others were not cooked fully. (I‚Äôm not the type to complain at a restaurant).\n\nFor me
column13: I don‚Äôt mind. But for my Persian GF
column14: she felt disrespected for being served this. We‚Äôve been to plenty of Persian restaurants and never was given these smaller portions for the same price.\n\nI‚Äôll give it another shot
column15: but I‚Äôm sure my Persian Gf won‚Äôt be excited...\n\nI‚Äôll share their portions vs other Persian restaurants portions.  Picture of Seven Valleys portion vs usual Persian restaurant.'
